channel.title: operating_system on Development Cheat Sheets
channel.description: Recent content in operating_system on Development Cheat Sheets

item.title: Alpine
item.description: Alpine Linux is a Linux distribution designed to be small, simple, and secure.

item.title: Debian
item.description: The Linux Debian operating system is used as the base for many other linux operating systems such as Ubuntu and the Raspberry Pi OS (formerly Raspbian).

item.title: Environmental Variables (Linux)
item.description: This page provides information about the use of environmental variables in linux.

item.title: Linux
item.description: Linux is a family of open-source Unix-like operating systems based on the Linux kernel, an operating system kernel first released on September 17, 1991, by Linus Torvalds.

item.title: Linux Tools
item.description: This page contains links to the Linux (and Unix) specific tools that I have discovered, and documented, as a part of my development journey.

item.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL)
item.description: Red Hat Enterprise Linux is a commercial Linux distribution developed by Red Hat for the commercial market.

item.title: RetroPie
item.description: Installing/Enabling the Pixel Desktop The PIXEL (formerly LXDE) desktop environment was removed from the RetroPie image to keep it smaller. It can easily be installed from the RetroPie Setup Script (~/RetroPie-Setup/retropie_setup.sh) In Configuration / Tools » Raspbiantools » Install Pixel Desktop Environment After installation, it will be accessible from the ports menu of EmulationStation or can be called from the command line with startx For more details see where did the desktop go

item.title: systemd
item.description: Systemd is a suite of basic building blocks for a Linux system. It provides a system and service manager that runs as PID 1 and starts the rest of the system.

item.title: Ubuntu
item.description: Ubuntu is a Linux distribution based on Debian and composed mostly of free and open-source software.

item.title: Windows
item.description: Microsoft Windows is a group of several proprietary graphical operating system families developed and marketed by Microsoft.
